text: @f_eira thinking of you after seeing this vid. Really be safe there bay 🙏

answers.text: @davidsihombing1 thanks vid! You stay safe too

text: It’s true. Singaporeans are very very lucky. So many other countries - the government is not helping or not doing enuf to address this issue.

Are u sure "literally be dying, then allowed to take test?" You cannot compare and criticise the way different governments work, without sufficient research. Moreover, Japan is a big country while Singapore is just a small country. I really wonder where these 3 so-called Singaporeans were picked from. 🤔😷

answers.text: @isahirokairi thank you for being aware and selective of the information you're exposed to. In this day and age with all the chaos happening, it's easy to sway and manipulate people's opinions. Appreciative of people like you.

text: Wah gg liao lo. If Japan or any other country don't play ball, we all Kena stuck
Well done, great propaganda video for SG and nice bashing your host country 👏🏻. Why not go home if it is as bad in Japan as you claim? Parasites.

answers.text: @holydrummer @holydrummer 1. You do not understand the full picture of why and how this interview was conducted. If you have differing views, approach us personally or mothership to clarify. Our names are plastered up there but for your convenience I put myself up here for you to contact. 2. In no way were we “bashing” up Japan. We merely stated our observations, with data and articles. It is your subjective view that we portrayed Japan as “bad” but in truth it is just what is observed. The “positive” things we said about Japan was left out but nevertheless this does not make it a Japan “bashing” video. If you think there is a problem, refer to my point 1. 3. We cannot reasonably return to SG so let’s put aside that suggestion. 4. Let’s not stoop to such a low level as to name calling. It’s terribly low Gregory Yeo

@ckmcflurry Hi Chun Kiat, thank you for your reply. First and foremost, I admit I lashed out at first instance and for that I do apologize unreservedly. However, I am also glad you confirmed that the positive things they were said about Japan were left out, which reinforces my point about the narrative of this video. I am frustrated at a slew of media outlets which seem to take particular aim at Japan and I am simply baffled at the fascination with how this country is dealing with COVID19 when they should really be looking at their own backyards. Again, I am sorry emotions got the better of me.

text: As a Singaporean  who’s also staying in japan, I have some differing views on this video...

answers.text: @ckmcflurry Hey there, thanks for your reply. I'm surprised someone from the video would comment. I understand that the entire interview can't be squeezed into a video unless it's like a Joe Rogan or London Real interview/podcast. I'd love to share my views but texting on instagram will not be able to justify all of them. Nevertheless, I'm glad to hear that you guys shared positive views. So my next question would then be why they weren't included in the final video. With the current state, people need to be empowered by positivity, not bring each other down. We learn from each other. The way this video is put together, it feels very biased towards Singapore, trying to tell Singaporeans to be appreciative of what the government is doing. With that said, I AM appreciative of what the govt has done for us but comparing other countries' policies with ours is not very fair as a lot of factors are not taken into account. And this is not just coming from me but Japanese friends as well. With the whole panic buy thing, it's not happening all over Japan. What was shown was probably in city areas where it's saturated with people, both local and foreigners. I can go on more about the other content shared within this video but it'll never end if I keep going on text. Mothership has chosen to show a certain narrative with this video. And in my opinion, it's not an objective one. It misleads Singaporeans who trust this platform and trust the people who are actually living in Japan. Fear is a deadlier virus. And the news and media are feeding it excessively. FYI, this is definitely not an attack on you or any of the people in the video. I question the producer of this video, their intent on choosing what segments to showcase, etc. In any case, I hope you guys are staying safe and healthy as well :)
@casswildcat you couldn’t have expressed it better, my sentiments exactly.
@casswildcat This content was not the entire interview. We had positive views about Japan too which wasn’t included in the final video. Would love to hear your views too.

text: ITS MY FRIEND @ckmcflurry 気を付けて！！！
